TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Articles.Content: Recently I learned that scaterrer only provides eclipse shadows to the bodies with atmospheres, you can even see it in the config. Is it possible to extend this functionality to all the bodies?

> 
> 
> 42 minutes ago, dok\_377 said:
> 
> 
> Recently I learned that scaterrer only provides eclipse shadows to the bodies with atmospheres, you can even see it in the config. Is it possible to extend this functionality to all the bodies?
> 

<abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)"><abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr></abbr> does it for all the bodies so you can use it's eclipse system for now.

<abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr>-redux uses the same soft eclipse shadows as scatterer now.

**Edited <time datetime="2022-01-13T15:34:03Z" title="01/13/2022 03:34  PM" data-short="2 yr">January 13, 2022</time> by blackrack**

> 
> 
> 4 minutes ago, blackrack said:
> 
> 
> <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)"><abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr></abbr> does it for all the bodies so you can use it's eclipse system for now.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)"><abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr></abbr>-redux uses the same soft eclipse shadows as scatterer now.
> 

Yep, that's what I'm using. It just doesn't look as good and renders on the other side of the body.

> 
> 
> 46 minutes ago, dok\_377 said:
> 
> 
> Yep, that's what I'm using. It just doesn't look as good and renders on the other side of the body.
> 

Show screenshots. It should look the same with eve-redux. The other side thing I have a fix for which I didn't propagate to eve. Guess I should unify the eclipse systems sometime, and improve how it's handled in scatterer to local objects and oceans.

**Edited <time datetime="2022-01-13T16:26:46Z" title="01/13/2022 04:26  PM" data-short="2 yr">January 13, 2022</time> by blackrack**

> 
> 
> 1 minute ago, blackrack said:
> 
> 
> Show screenshots. It should look the same with eve-redux.
> 

I'm sorry, what I said was not clear. What I meant is it doesn't look good *because* it's rendering on the other side. It doesn't look worse than scaterrer's one in terms of quality. My bad.
How do I tone down that odd wavy effect on the cabin lights?

> 
> 
> 9 hours ago, AtomicTech said:
> 
> 
> How do I tone down that odd wavy effect on the cabin lights?
> 

The what

> 
> 
> 20 hours ago, AtomicTech said:
> 
> 
> How do I tone down that odd wavy effect on the cabin lights?
> 

I think that's from TUFX, I've seen it sometimes when HDR's activated.

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, GuessingEveryDay said:
> 
> 
> I think that's from TUFX, I've seen it sometimes when HDR's activated.
> 

What’s HDR?

(Asides from High Def Resolution)

also, I don’t have TUFX

> 
> 
> On 1/15/2022 at 4:02 PM, AtomicTech said:
> 
> 
> How do I tone down that odd wavy effect on the cabin lights?
> 

I beleive this is from the Scatterer SMAA, which can be turned off, but sadly that means you won't have anti-aliasing anymore as Scatterer disables the stock MSAA and the Scatterer TAA is broken. You could try using anti-aliasing from TUFX.

[EDIT] This is a Parallax issue, not Scatterer. I first noticed it when installing Scaterrer so misclassified the issue. Moving to Parallax support thread..  

Hi all, could someone comment on a pixelation issue? You can see it in the distance in this picture. I have both Scatterer and <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)"><abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> [edit] and Parallax</abbr> - not sure if that's related, or if I need to fix my Scatterer config. Thanks!

**Edited <time datetime="2022-01-22T10:37:02Z" title="01/22/2022 10:37  AM" data-short="2 yr">January 22, 2022</time> by Voqk**

Would it be possible for Scatterer to change the color of stock particle effects at sunset/sunrise, similar to what it does to <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> clouds? I think this would be pretty cool- dust kicked up by your Duna lander scattered blue...

Hi there, doing some mod updates with other mods and ran into a weird issue. Scatterer somehow thinks it's incompatible with itself on <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)"><abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr></abbr>. Whenever I try and install any mod at all or make any change, I immediately get the error "\* Scatterer 3:v0.0830 conflicts with Scatterer"  

Any idea why? I haven't changed anything with Scatterer and the mods I'm trying to install don't effect Scatterer in any way. I can't even remove mods; any modlist update in <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)"><abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr></abbr> gives me this error. I'm also not trying to remove or update Scatterer.

I'll also add that the mod itself is working perfectly fine in-game. I jus can't do anything in <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> unless I remove it.

**Edited <time datetime="2022-01-30T04:54:28Z" title="01/30/2022 04:54  AM" data-short="2 yr">January 30, 2022</time> by RyGuy\_McFly**

[@blackrack](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/104258-blackrack/) I've been having a problem with scatterer 0.0830. I know this is a problem with scatterer in particular because these issues resolve themselves when I revert back to version 0.0772. The problem with this is that certain features are unavailable, and, despite the problems I've found, I can see some improvements present in 0.0830 compared to 0.0772, which is why I would like to resolve the issue instead of running away from it. Don't want to miss out on future versions of scatterer.

A summary of the problem is that many colours aren't what they're supposed to be. A complete list is available in the following link: [https://imgur.com/a/uEaqGnQ](https://imgur.com/a/uEaqGnQ)

**Edited <time datetime="2022-01-30T06:59:14Z" title="01/30/2022 06:59  AM" data-short="2 yr">January 30, 2022</time> by intelliCom**

It's because 'visual packs' that mainly just provide their own Scatterer and <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)"><abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr></abbr> setups haven't been updated to work with Scatterer's new functionality. At the time of writing this affects AVP, Spectra, SVE etc. etc.

It has nothing, per se, to do with Scatterer. Scatterer is working just fine.

**Edited <time datetime="2022-01-30T08:40:46Z" title="01/30/2022 08:40  AM" data-short="2 yr">January 30, 2022</time> by Poodmund**

> 
> 
> Would it be possible for Scatterer to change the color of stock particle effects at sunset/sunrise, similar to what it does to <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)"><abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr></abbr> clouds? I think this would be pretty cool- dust kicked up by your Duna lander scattered blue...
> 

Scatterer changes the color of sunlight so if these particles took into account light color they would have it seamlessly. I'm not personally interested in modifying the particles shaders but if someone else wants to do it they just have to take into account \_LightColor0 and it's done.

Scatterer keeps setting itself back to "integrated" when I restart KSP even though I apply "Very High".  Am I missing something to make it stick to "Very High"?

Apologies if this has already been addressed, but is there a fix yet for Scatterer causing Kerbin's atmosphere to extend out massively 5 times it's normal height yet? I have Scatterer with AVP and it looks unimmersive and awful with the new look, it was perfectly fine before the recent update.  It was raised a while ago, but haven't seen any fixes yet. 

Any help to fix the terrible new huge atmosphere would be appreciated. Thanks!

Edit: Here is a link of the previous post describing this same problem - [https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/103963-wip19x-112x-scatterer-atmospheric-scattering-00830-28012022-scattering-improvements-in-game-atmo-generation-and-multi-sun-support/&do=findComment&comment=4055263](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/103963-wip19x-112x-scatterer-atmospheric-scattering-00830-28012022-scattering-improvements-in-game-atmo-generation-and-multi-sun-support/&do=findComment&comment=4055263)
